description: Dynamic NIM is an implementation of the logic game NIM. There are a number of chips, defined by the player. The player and computer take turns grabbing a number of chips. The player who takes the last chip wins the game. There are some rules, you can't take all chips on the first turn. Player and computer may not remove more than twice the number of chips the other removed. The display shows the remaining chips and the maximum number of chips a player can remove.
title: Dynamic NIM

description: Jeu de NIM is an implementation of the mathematical game NIM for the SR-52. The player can decide on the number of rows and the number of items per row. The AI and player then take turns removing a number of items of choice from a single row. Whoever takes the last piece loses the game.
title: Jeu de NIM

description: Submarine! is a variation on Battleship. A submarine is hidden in a 100 by 100 grid. You can deploy a depth charge at any point in the grid. After the depth charge is destroyed the sonar equipment of your ship can detect the echo on the submarine and the distance of the submarine to the explosion. The submarine will try to move away, but it can only go up and right in the grid. Only a direct hit destroys the submarine. When hitting within five squares it counts as a minor hit. After four minor hits the submarine quickly speeds off to a new position where it is repaired. An updated version of the game restricts the submarine to the initial 100x100 grid and also gives a direction after each depth charge.
title: Submarine!

description: Son of Submarine is a game inspired by Submarine!. The player is still chasing a submarine in a 100x100 grid. The player can fire depth charges after which the submarine moves. The player is told the distance towards the new location, which can be anywhere in the 100x100 grid or beyond it (but only up or to the right). The player needs to perform a direct hit to destroy the submarine. When hitting within five tiles the submarine receives a minor hit. After five minor hits the submarine has a large speed burst and repairs. The submarine can make various chess-piece moves (and some derived moves) which allow the player to use some probability to determine the location.
title: Son of Submarine

description: In Battleship an enemy ship is hidden in a 100x100 grid. The player may fire shots at coordinates in an attempt to hit it. After each shot the distance between the impact and the ship is made known also the enemy ship moves a number of units. When hits are within five units of the ship a minor hit is scored and the ship. Five minor hits will make the ship instantly repair at a support vessel. If the impact is less than one unit away from the ship, the ship is instantly destroyed and the player wins the game.
title: Battleship

description: This SR-56 Lunar Lander game is similar to Lunar Lander games for HP calculators but has some minor differences. The player defines the starting parameters of the game, including starting altitude, pounds of fuel and initial falling speed. Each action the player inputs corresponds with the actions of the lander for the next second of time. For each action the player can set the fuel burn rate to any value between 0 and 75 pounds of fuel per second. The goal is to reach the moon's surface with a velocity of five feet per second or less. The player only has limited fuel to burn.
title: Lunar Lander

description: Yahtzee is an implementation of the classic dice game for the SR-52. The player rolls five dice and tries to make matches, being allowed a limited number of re-rolls.
title: Yahtzee

description: Corner the Lady is a game invented around 1960 also known as Queens, or for its more abstract form of Wythoff's Nim. This implementation allows the player to play it on a programmable calculator. The computer and player control a queen (chess piece) on a grid with the restriction that it can only move south, south-west or south. The player and computer take turns in moving the queen and whoever corners it at the bottom wins the game.
title: Corner the Lady

description: Tic Tac Toe is a typical Tic-Tac-Toe game for the TI Programmable Calculator. Player and computer take turns putting their mark on the three by three grid trying to get three in a row.
title: Tic Tac Toe

description: Twenty-One "A" is a blackjack game implemented for the SR-56 programmable calculator. The player receives cards and must get as close to a value of 21 without going over or be bust.
title: Twenty-One "A"

description: SR-52 Card Blackjack is an implementation of the classic casino card game for the SR-52 programmable calculator. The player and house must try to get 21 in card value without going over or be bust. Each play starts with the player entering a bet. On a turn the player can hit, stand or double down when his card value equals 10 or 11. The house always stands at 17 or higher.
title: SR-52 Card Blackjack

description: Code Breaker is an implementation of the board game Mastermind for a programmable calculator. The computer thinks of a four digit code and the player must try to guess it. After each guess the amount of correct numbers and correct numbers in the correct location is made known, giving clues for the player to induce the actual code.
title: Code Breaker

description: Basketball is a turn based game for two players. Players alternate between offense and defense. The player on offense secretly keys a number. The other player tries to match it. The closer the player on defense gets to the original number the better the counter resulting in for example ball control. After a number of plays the game ends.
title: Basketball

description: Number Guesser is a number guessing game. The player must guess a number in the range of 0-99999. After each guess, the valid range of numbers is given revealing information on whether your guess was above or below the mystery number.
title: Number Guesser

description: Twenty-One is an implementation of the card game blackjack for the SR-52 programmable calculator. The player and dealer are both dealt two cards and must make a decision to receive another card. The goal is to reach a card value of 21, but when going over the player is bust.
title: Twenty-One

description: Mortar Fire is an artillery game for the SR-52 programmable calculator. The player must provide an (x,y) coordinate for a target to hit with a mortar. For each shot the player gives a bearing and elevation. The player is then told if the shot hit the target or if not the distance it missed by. The player must hit the target within five shots.
title: Mortar Fire

description: Sea Battle pits the player in an incapacitated missile frigate. A nuclear submarine was last reported at 15,000 yards at an unknown bearing. It's heading towards the player at 30 knots. The player can fire fifteen missiles in an attempt to destroy the submarine. If the missiles explodes within 500 yards of the submarine the submarine takes damage and its speed is reduced by 6 knots, it takes evasive action rotating 45 degrees. A direct hit (50 yards or less) sinks the submarine. The player loses if all missiles are fired or when the sub comes within 500 yards.
title: Sea Battle

description: Nim is an implementation of the classic game for the SR-52 programmable calculator. This version has seven piles of seven items. The player and AI take turns taking a number of items from a given pile. The player who takes the last item loses the game.
title: Nim

description: Baseball pits two players against each other in a match of baseball. The pitching team must decide for each pitch to swing or take. In the case of a swing the game determines if it's a strike or a hit and in case of a hit how many bases are advanced.
title: Baseball

description: Football is a simulation of American Football for two players on the SR-52 programmable calculator with a connected printer. When in possession of the ball the player must decide to perform a short pass, run or long pass. The printout shows the movement of the ball. The ball must advance at least ten yards in four plays or possession changes to the other player. A touchdown scores six or seven points and safeties count for two points.
title: Football

description: Parachute requires the player to set a timer for his or her parachute to open based on a plane's altitude and terminal velocity. The goals is to have it open as close to the ground as possible. When using a printer it shows moment to moment updates about the player's fall.
title: Parachute

description:
Games Library: Program Manual is a compilation of mostly game programs for the SR-52 programmable calculator. It features the following programs:

  • Number Guesser
  • Hi-Lo
  • Interchange
  • Codebreaker
  • Star Buster
  • Craps
  • Twenty-One
  • Mars Lander
  • Phantom Ship
  • Mortar Fire
  • Sea Battle
  • Biorhythm Compatability (not a game)
  • ESP Evaluator (not a game)
  • Day of the Week, Days between Dates (not a game)
  • Banker for Monopoly® Game (not a game)
  • Nim
  • Baseball
  • Basketball
  • Football
  • Parachute
title: Games Library: Program Manual

description: Golf is a golfing game played on a programmable calculator. There are eighteen holes and they can be played with one or two players. Each time a player is on turn that player must pick a club which will determine the approximate distance covered.
title: Golf

description: Cross-Country Balloon Trip places the player 1001 miles from his or her goal destination. Each day a wind direction and velocity is given. The player must decide to launch that day and for how many hours to fly which will change the player's distance to the destination.
title: Cross-Country Balloon Trip

description: Checkers is an implementation of the classic board game for the TI-59 Calculator. The player plays against the AI. The player can choose to go first or not, afterwards the player must enter his or her move into the calculator on their turn, while the calculator displays the AIs move on theirs. The player has to use an actual checkers board to keep track of the game board. The AI is limited to making single jumps, but the player can do multiple jumps in a single turn when possible.
title: Checkers

description: Super-Code-Breaker is an enhanced version of Code Breaker. In this Mastermind variant, the calculator will try to guess your secret number sequence and vice versa. The code can be up to eight digits long, but cannot have zeroes or repeated digits.
title: Super-Code-Breaker

description: Craps Revisited. is an adaptation of an earlier implementation of the dice game craps for the Texas Instruments programmable calculator. This version will print out a graphic of the rolled dice on a paper tape after each roll. It requires the leisure module for the TI-58/59 to be installed.
title: Craps Revisited.

description:
Leisure Library is a compilation of many programs on solid state magnetic cards for use on the TI-58/59 programmable calculators. The following games are included:

  • Codebreaker - a Mastermind variant in which a four digit code needs to be cracked.
  • Blackjack - an implementation of the classic casino card game.
  • Acey-Deucy - a number guessing game.
  • Craps - an implementation of the classic casino dice game.
  • Mars Lander - a lunar lander variant.
  • Jive Turkey - a number guessing game. After each guess the calculator will tell if the player is high or low, but sometimes it's lying.
  • Hangman - a word guessing game for two players.
  • Learning Nim - a version of Nim with a learning AI.
  • Football - a football game in which players take turns to input the moves of their quarterback.
  • Sea Battle - a submarine hunting game. The player has fifteen missiles to fire at a moving submarine hidden in a grid.
title: Leisure Library

description: Football (Solitaire) is a turn-based American Football simulation in which the player plays against the computer. When on turn the player can perform various actions such as a kickoff, punt, field goal attempt, time out, and three different plays from scrimmage. Based on the odds the result can be a touchdown, safety, field goal, fumble, incomplete pass, interception or penalties. The computer makes the same decisions on its own turn.
title: Football (Solitaire)

description: Golf allows to the player to play an 18-hole course on the TI-59 programmable calculator. Two players take turns. Players can choose between seven clubs including a putter on their turn. The selected club determines the distance covered.
title: Golf

description: Game of Gale is played against the TI-59 calculator. The player and AI take turns connecting dots in two off-set grids. The aim is to connect the top to the bottom of the grid, but lines may not cross each other so players can block each other's plans. The player can keep track of the grid on a piece of paper or automatically using the PC-100A printer.
title: Game of Gale

description: Arithmetic Game is an educational game which times the player in solving a set of arithmetic correctly. The program has a selectable difficulty setting.
title: Arithmetic Game

description: Deluxe Baseball is a baseball game playable on the TI-59 programmable calculator. The player can set the team names, and compared to earlier baseball games there are lots of situations that can occur including ground-outs, pop-outs, fly-outs, foul-outs and strike-outs. The score is printed out using the printer and pitching is automated.
title: Deluxe Baseball

description: SINAM, 2 Digits or Speedy Interactive MAster Mind is a code breaking competition between the player and the TI-59 calculator. Both need to break each other's code using a combination of strategy and luck. This version of the game uses a code of two digits.
title: SIMAM, 2 Digits

description: SINAM, 3 Digits or Speedy Interactive MAster Mind is a code breaking competition between the player and the TI-59 calculator. Both need to break each other's code using a combination of strategy and luck. This version of the game uses a code of three digits.
title: SIMAM, 3 Digits

description: Learning NIMB is an implementation of the mathematical game NIM. In this variant there is a pile of variable objects (up to 19) and the player and AI take turns to remove up to three objects from the pile. The player to take the last object loses the game. The "learning" part of the title refers to the cybernetic learning routines of the AI which starts out as a novice but will become an expert after some games of play against the player.
title: Learning NIMB

description: Commander in Chief is based on the game of the same name that appeared in The Pocket Calculator Game Book. Whereas the game book version is a description of a single player game in which a calculator can aid in the math required to play the game, the TI-58 version allows the player to play the described game against the AI with everything being automated on the calculator. Each turn (year) the player may increase the stockpile of snowballs (nuclear weapons in the original) by 100. Each turn war may be declared and the player must find out the AIs number of snowballs. If the player has more snowballs the player wins the war, but if the total amount of snowballs is too high, a holocaust occurs and everybody loses. After each war the number of snowballs is reduced. The player wins if he can stay alive for 10 turns.
title: Commander in Chief

description: Scrambled Eggs is a code guessing game. The player starts with the sequence 123456789 and must find the hidden scrambled sequence. Each turn the player can reverse a part of the code and the calculator will respond with the number of digits that are in the correct position. The player wins once the numbers are in the same order as the hidden sequence.
title: Scrambled Eggs

description: Horse Race is a horse race betting simulation. Players can bet on six horses with different odds and start with $100. After all bets are placed the horses race and after 30 seconds the results are shown and the payouts for each player.
title: Horse Race

description: The One Armed Bandit simulates a Mills 10¢ slot machine used in Las Vegas and Atlantic City in the 1970s. It uses the same odds. The machine has three wheels and seven symbols that the player must line up. Each wheel has 20 positions and different distribution of symbols. Each spin and payout is printed.
title: The One Armed Bandit

description: Son-in-Law of Submarine is an adaptation of Son of Submarine. The player must still find a moving submarine target hidden in a grid and try to hit it with depth charges. Aside from optimized code this version features score keeping and will print the number of tries the player took to destroy the sub.
title: Son-in-Law of Submarine

description: Tiger Trouble! places the player on a boat safari-gone bad when a crewman has fallen ill. The player heads out alone to find a doctor but is stalked by a man-eating tiger. The player can move from location to location and must reach the village without getting eaten and also return back to the landing dock. The player uses a printed map to know where to go and after each move by player and tiger the tiger will roar, revealing its approximate location (swamp, dock, forest, plains, hills, village). The player can use this information to change direction. The tiger can roam freely and is not limited to the same location connections as the player, but the player can cross a creek by rivers that the tiger doesn't dare to use.
title: Tiger Trouble!

description: Game of Kayles is played with two players or against the AI. The players alternate turns and can either remove a single pin or two adjacent pins from a row of ten pins. The player to knock out the last pin wins the game. There is a miss-chance which adds an element of luck to the game.
title: Game of Kayles

description: Calculator Ping-Pong is a Pong variant played on a programmable calculator. Two players can play against each other or one against the calculator. The ball, represented by a zero will move across the screen through the digits and must be returned when it reaches the player's side of the screen. Acting too soon or too late will result in a loss.
title: Calculator Ping-Pong

description: Ant Invasion is a puzzle game in which the player must find a hidden formula. A million ants on five continents start multiplying and their rate of increase must be guessed before they reach a certain number. For each guess the ants give clues if the player is on track, but some times the ants lie with their clues.
title: Ant Invasion

description: Game of Blitz is a solitaire dice game. The player starts with a sequence of nine digits on the display. After each roll of two six-sided dice the player can eliminate any number or combination of numbers that add up to the total given by the dice. The player loses if no moves are possible and wins if all digits are removed.
title: Game of Blitz

description: Automatic Draw Poker is a poker game for up to nine players. Players each hold the calculator in turn to view their cards and can open, stay, raise and fold. Once all bets are equalized the player with the best hand wins. The game uses jackpots rule, meaning no player can start betting unless their hand contains at least a pair of jacks or higher. Due to the limitations of the calculator's screen there are no suits and thus no possibility for flushes.
title: Automatic Draw Poker

description: Double Play Game is a variant on Nim. Players take turns to grab items from a pile. Whoever takes the last item wins. Players can take any number of items from the pile in their turn as long as it's at least one and not more than twice the amount the other player took.
title: Double Play Game

description: Game of Qubic is a tic-tac-toe game played on a 4x4x4 board. The player and AI take turns placing their marks with the aim to get four in a row.
title: Game of Qubic

description: Basketball is a two player simulation of the sports. Each player controls a five-man team. Each shooter has different stats and passing the ball to better shooters improves the odds of scoring. The game also simulates fouls, stolen balls and has a scoreboard with timer.
title: Basketball

description: Memory Flashcards is a simple memory training game where the player is shown rapidly flashed digits and must try to remember them. The amount of digits per number can be changed for different difficulties.
title: Memory Flashcards

description: Super Mindbreaker is a Mastermind variant played on a programmable calculator. The program allows codes up to nine digits in length and nine digits per location. Codes include repeating digits. The computer generates the code and responds to the player's guesses.
title: Super Mindbreaker

description: Battleship is a programmable calculator implementation of the board game of the same name. The players fires at ship hidden in a grid by the other player. A printer can be used to print the hit or miss messages or review the current state of the grid. This version uses a 9x9 grid.
title: Battleship

description: Keno is an implementation of the Las Vegas bingo-type game for a programmable calculator. It allows for solitaire play.
title: Keno

description:
Game of Life is an implementation of Conway's Game of Life for the TI-59 Programmable Calculator. The player can draw patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

The player defines the starting cells in a 10x10 area and can print generations. The printed generations will cover an area of 20x25 cells.
title: Game of Life

description:
Adult Game Library is a deceptively named compilation of games for the TI-59 Programmable Calculator. Some programs can be modified to run on the TI-58. The games are:

  • Craps
  • Shark
  • Earthquake
  • Tic Tac Toe
  • Eight Ball
  • Black Jack
  • Horse Race
  • Letters
  • Rip Cord
  • Employee Evaluation
title: Adult Game Library

description: Casino Blackjack is an implementation of the popular casino card game for the TI-59 programmable calculator. The game allows up to six players to bet, hit, stand, double down, insure and split pairs in a full implementation of the Las Vegas rules. The goals for each player is to get a card value as close to 21 without going over. The player loses their bet if going bust or having a value lower than the dealer.
title: Casino Blackjack

description:
59 Fun is a compilation of programs submitted to PPX-59, the Professional Program Exchange for the TI-59 programmable calculator. It includes the following games, some of which were not available earlier:

  • Baseball (previously released for the SR-52)
  • Parachute (previously released for the SR-52)
  • Tic-Tac-Toe - Play the classic pen and paper game against the calculator.
  • Poem Machine (not a game) - Gramatically correct but randomly constructed verses are printed.
  • Space War - The player must try to destroy an enemy base, but two missiles controlled by the calculator must be avoided. (adapted from a SR-52 program)
  • Hexpawn - Tactical game on a 3x3 chessboard with both the player and calculator controlling three pawns which follow normal Chess rules. Uses cybernetic AI that learns the optimal strategy after some games.
  • Skydiving - Enhanced version of Parachute
title: 59 Fun

description: Drug Wars is a port of the DOS title Drug Wars: A Game Based on the New York Drug Market for the TI-82 Programmable Calculator by Jonathan Maier. It is not clear whether there is feature parity or if the port was developed legally and with consent of the original author.
title: Drug Wars

description: Desolate is a top-down role-playing game where the player is placed aboard a deserted spaceship and left to uncover the horrible fate of the crew, and hopefully survive the threats they will face along the way. Solving puzzles, collecting items, and evading enemies will be your tools to learn the secrets of the space cruiser Desolate. This game is designed for TI-83 and TI-84 calculators.
title: Desolate

description: ESP is a very simple game about guessing numbers. The calculator will pick randomly 0 or 1 and it's up to the player to guess it. The game keeps score.
title: ESP

description: Race Car is a variant of the originally pen-and-paper racing game Racetrack. The game is played on a piece of graph paper with a race track drawn on it. The players use different colored pens to mark their path on the track. The game is played in a turn-based fashion and each turn the players input their desired actions (break, accelerate, cruise and steering left or right). The calculator will give their new position on the grid. Each turn represents a single second of the race. The first player to reach the finish wins. When racing alone the player can try to beat their own track record.
title: Race Car

description: Digits is a Mastermind variant. The player must guess the code of numbers the computer has stored. The computer will respond by giving the number of correct digits in the correct place and those who are correct but incorrectly placed. By default the program uses 4-digit codes and only accepts the numbers 1 through 6, but the program can be easily adjusted to use all numbers and use codes from 2 to 9 in length. Codes can take any form including duplicate numbers.
title: Digits

description:
Jump Hole Gunner places the player in the role of a gunner on a space ship. The player can go on various missions to earn money and promotions. At higher ranks the game will also become more difficult with more and more difficult targets. The player can earn a promotion three times. Each mission allows the player to fire six times at incoming alien invaders. There are five different types of enemies which require different actions from the player such as firing immediately when spotted, waiting until the right moment or not firing at all in the case of a highly explosive mine. Another possible encounter is a friendly supply ship which obviously shouldn't be shot either. Unlike most shooting games there's no aiming involved, it's all about timing the shots. The game features audio which can be picked up with an AM transistor radio.

The game has three game modes: a training simulator which doesn't keep persistent score between missions, the extended mode where the player starts at the lowest promotion level and gradually levels up and the simplified game where players can choose a specific difficulty and fly a single mission. The last can be used to play hot-seat multiplayer and compete for the highest score.
title: Jump Hole Gunner

description: PPX-59 Catalog is a compilation of all programs from Texas Instruments' PPX-59 user contributed program library. All games are written to run on a TI-59 programmable calculator. The compilation contains many programs with only a portion of them being games. What makes this compilation special is that it's released on microfiche. All programs are available as type-in games and include full documentation.
title: PPX-59 Catalog

description: Star Trek is a Star Trek variant for the TI-59 programmable calculator. The player controls the starship Enterprise and must rid the galaxy of Klingon battle cruisers. There are 9 quadrants to explore, which will contain star bases to refuel and restock and stars to hinder the player's movement. The player uses short and long range scans to find the enemy and controls phasers and shields when engaged in combat.
title: Star Trek

description: Hamurabi is a version of the classic empire management game. The player is in charge of a realm and must each turn decide whether to buy or sell land, how much food should be distributed and how many acres should be planted. The goal is to grow the population and the game can go on indefinitely as long as the player doesn't drive their empire into ruin.
title: Hamurabi

description: Aircraft Carrier Landing is a flight simulator focused solely on landing on a carrier. The game takes place during World War II and the player must land a F6F-3 Fumman Hellcat which is out of ammo after an attack on Japanese targets. The player controls the airspeed and degree of dive, but can come under attack by an enemy Zero.
title: Aircraft Carrier Landing

description: Seven Card Stud Poker is a poker game for two to seven players for the TI-59 programmable calculator. The game uses the printer to print the player's hands after each card dealt. A player can pass at any time, or bet or call. Normal poker rules apply to determine who wins the round. The game doesn't simulate an actual deck and instead just randomly creates a card every time a card is drawn. This can cause cards to appear more than once.
title: Seven Card Stud Poker

description: Automatic Crap Game allows one or more players to play the dice gambling game Craps on a TI-59 programmable calculator. Dice throw results can be printed or simply be displayed on the screen. When printing it prints actual pictures of the dice rather than just printing the numbers.
title: Automatic Crap Game

description: Action Craps allows one player to play the dice gambling game Craps on a TI-59 programmable calculator. Dice throw results are printed. The player can bet on the result of a round, but also place up to four side bets on different points.
title: Action Craps

description: Casino Roulette allows a single player to play a simulation of roulette gambling. A wheel is spun and depending on the player's bets the player might win money. The player can bet on single numbers, two numbers, four numbers, half columns, double columns, first, second or third of numbers, a random set of twelve numbers, manque (first half of numbers), passe (second half of numbers), even, odd, black or red.
title: Casino Roulette

description: Chuck-A-Luck Dice Game is a simulation of the dice gambling game of the same name. The player starts with a hundred dollars. The player bets on a number from one to six. After the bet three dice are thrown. If the number appears once the player gets their money back, if it appears more than once the player can double or triple their initial bet. If the number doesn't appear all money is lost.
title: Chuck-A-Luck Dice Game

description: The Black Box is a puzzle game in which the player tries to find atoms hidden in a grid. The player does so by firing rays into the grid from the borders. Rays normally travel in a straight line. Rays that strike an atom are absorbed. Rays that come within one square of an atom in a diagonal direction are deflected 90 degrees. Rays aimed directly between two atoms one square apart are deflected. Rays that enter the grid directly to the side of an atom are deflected.
title: The Black Box

description: Blackjack for 13 Players allows up to 13 players to play blackjack on the TI-59 programmable calculator. Players play against the dealer and try to get a card value as close to 21 without going over. Players must beat the dealer to win a bet.
title: Blackjack for 13 Players

description: Hi-Q is a peg solitaire game. The player must clear a board of pegs until only one is left in the center of the board. Pegs can be removed by jumping over them with another peg. After each move the state of the board is printed.
title: Hi-Q

description: Hangman is a word game where the player guesses letters until a word can be guessed. After each guess the position of the guessed letters in the word is printed. All words are five letters and the game comes with an expandable library of 40 words.
title: Hangman

description: Advanced Baseball is a baseball game for two players. The player that pitches can throw four different balls and the player that controls the batter can choose to either swing or not. Depending on the choices made and some random chance the situation on the field will change.
title: Advanced Baseball

description: Magic Square is a puzzle game. The player is presented with a 3 by 3 grid filled with 0s and 1s. The player must change the pattern to a target pattern by changing 0s and 1s but this requires finding out the rules because changing a value can have side-effects on the value of adjacent tiles. The pattern is printed using the printer accessory.
title: Magic Square

description: Hanoi Game Simulator is a puzzle game in which the player must move a tower consisting of disks of decreasing size. There are only three places to place the disks and a disk can only be stacked on a bigger disk.
title: Hanoi Game Simulator

description:
In Dungeons and Dragons the player takes on the role of a hero that goes into a dungeon to recover a treasure. The player wins if the player manages to exit the dungeon with the treasure, and loses when the player runs out of hitpoints. The player starts with 13 hitpoints. The treasure is located at the center of a 15x15 grid. Twelve dragons are also placed in predetermined locations on the grid. The player starts at a random position and is assigned a random ending position. When moving between tiles the player may encounter a monster which costs the player a random amount of hitpoints, good luck charms which restore some hitpoints, and secret passages which teleport you to another space in the grid.

When encountering a dragon, the player has to play a little mini-game where the dragon will think of two numbers. Given one, the player must guess if the other is higher or lower than the given number. If the player is correct, some hitpoints are again restored.

All events are printed using the printer accessory for the TI-59 calculator.
title: Dungeons and Dragons

description: Checkmate! is a game for two players. It plays like a turn-based version of a Light Cycle game. The game is played on a board with 15x10 tiles. The players take turns placing blocks on the board with the rule that a placed block (except the first) must be adjacent to a previously placed block by the same player. The goal is to cut the other player off so that no more valid moves are possible. After each turn the state of the board can be printed.
title: Checkmate!

description: Wipeout! is a puzzle game in which all targets in a 6x9 grid must be eliminated. The player is presented with two randomized numbers and can accept or decline them. When accepted the numbers are fed into a calculation and can cause certain parts of the grid to be hit. The new state of the grid is then printed out. After a certain number of tries the player finds out how well they did with a number of hits, tries and average hit per try.
title: Wipeout!

description: Toe-Tic-Tac is Tic-Tac-Toe with a twist. The normal rules of the game apply, but the goals are different. The player wins by forcing a draw (i.e. neither player gets three in a row). The computer wins if either the player or computer gets three in a row.
title: Toe-Tic-Tac

description: Son of Jive Turkey is a number game. The player must guess a number, to which the calculator answers higher or lower. The calculator has the ability to lie. The game is an evolution of Jive Turkey, but instead of the player giving a probability for lies once, the calculator changes probability each turn, but will tell the player the odds.
title: Son of Jive Turkey

description: Duel pits the player against the calculator into a Western-style shootout. The player and calculator are on a road and constantly getting closer to each other. The player can fire their gun to try to kill the computer. Whether the player hits or misses is defined by odds. The quicker the player fires, the less points that awards, the longer the player waits the more points are scored for a kill. The calculator works by the same rule, but if the player and calculator ever reach each other the calculator gets an automatic win and an additional five bonus points. The game is played over multiple rounds.
title: Duel

description: Bullseye Game allows the player to play darts against the calculator. Both the player and calculator get five darts. The player has little control over the darts, so there's little interactivity.
title: Bullseye Game

description: Jumbled Letters is a word guessing game. The player is shown six letters in a jumbled order and must guess the word. The game comes with 70 words and more words can be added.
title: Jumbled Letters

description: Bango is a card game for ten players that borrows elements from Bingo. The game uses two stocks of cards and a designated dealer (the calculator). Each player receives five cards from the same deck. The dealer then reveals five cards from the second deck one at a time. If a card is revealed that the player has they can put it down. The first player to lose their entire hand wins the round.
title: Bango

description: Ski Race is a ski racing game based on Slalom. There are fifteen gates to pass through. Each gate has a known maximum speed to enter them through unhindered. The player has to throttle their speed each turn (steady, up, or down). If the player's speed drops below 7 mph the player is sent back to the last gate. The game features three skill levels.
title: Ski Race

description: Wythoff's Nim implements the specific Nim variant. There are two piles of matches and the players take turns removing matches. In a turn a player can either take one or more matches from one pile or an identical number from both piles. The person to take the last match wins. The game can be played against the computer or another player.
title: Wythoff's Nim

description: Stars is a number guessing game similar to Stars. The computer thinks of a number between 1 and 100 and the player must guess it within 5 turns. Instead of telling the player if the number is higher or lower the calculator prints a number of stars to indicate proximity to the number. When guessing the number correctly a new round starts where the number range is doubled and the player receives one additional guess.
title: Stars

description: Blackjack is a simulation of the card betting game. One player plays against the dealer. The game uses a stock of two decks of cards. The goal is to get a card value as close to 21 as possible without going over. The player wins the round if they get closer than the dealer. The player can split pairs. Aces count as either 1 or 11.
title: Blackjack

description: Black Jack (One Player) is a Blackjack game for one player and is played against the dealer. The goal is to get a card value as close to 21 as possible without going over. All the dealt cards are printed using the TI-59's printer accessory.
title: Black Jack (One Player)

description: Battleship is a calculator version of the classic pen and paper game. The player plays against the calculator. Each have their ships (a carrier, battleship, submarine and destroyer) hidden in a 10x10 grid and can strike one grid position each turn until one of the fleets is entirely destroyed. The effects of each shot are printed using the printer accessory of the TI-59 calculator.
title: Battleship

description: Roulet - 59 is a simulation of the casino gambling game. The player can bet virtual money and then a random number will be generated. If the number and/or color matches with the player's bet a payout is earned. Different types of bets have different odds for the payout. The game allows for all bets that are also allowed in casinos (such as straight, split, street, corner, line, line of 6 numbers, columns, dozens, color, odd or even, and high or low).
title: Roulet - 59

description: Hangman is a word guessing game for two players. One player enters a word and the other tries to guess it one letter at a time. If the letter occurs in the word the locations are printed. The goal is to guess the word within a limited number of guesses. Words can be up to 20 letters long.
title: Hangman

description: Space Search is a mathematical puzzle game. The player is tasked to find a UFO hidden in 15x15x15 three dimensional grid. The player can move to any location in the grid and must get within 10 yards (one grid point) of the UFO to spot it. After each move the player is shown the distance to the UFO.
title: Space Search

description: Cross Country Auto Race is a race from New York to California in a simulation of the "Cannonball Baker Sea-To-Shining-Sea Memorial Trophy Dash". The player can choose between three vehicles (Vete, Van and V.W.) and depending on their speed the cars run with a certain mileage. The player can input the desired speed for each tank of gas. Going faster than the speed limit increases the chance of getting caught on radar which adds an hour to the player's racing time. Later in the race there's a probability of the car breaking down, adding a further 2 hours delay. If the player manages to get to California within 40 hours they receive a trophy.
title: Cross Country Auto Race

description: Hunt the Wumpus is a version of the classic BASIC game for the TI-59 programmable calculator. The player hunts down a Wumpus inside a cave system. The cave consists of rooms, each one connects to three others. Some rooms contain hazards and the player only has five arrows that must be used wisely. The player loses if the player runs out of arrows, falls into a pit or runs into the Wumpus. Each turn the player can move to another room and can fire into an adjacent room. Aside from pits the player can also encounter bats who will move the player to another room. Warnings will inform the player when near to special rooms.
title: Hunt the Wumpus

description: The Remainder Game is a number guessing game. The calculator picks a number and the player must guess. After each guess the player is shown the remainder if the hidden number is divided by the player's guess. The goal is to guess the number in as few tries as possible.
title: The Remainder Game

description: Baseball III is a two-player baseball game. The players take turns pitching and batting. There are 10 different types of pitches. Different baseball players have different batting skills and as the batter the player always has the option to either go for the ball or not for each pitch. At each time the player will see the odds for hitting the ball.
title: Baseball III

description: Improved Tic Tac Toe allows the player to play the classic pen and paper game against the calculator. The calculator can be set to three skill levels. A printer can be used optionally to print the board.
title: Improved Tic Tac Toe

description: Trap Game is a number guessing game. The player can give two numbers and the calculator will reveal if the secret number is "trapped" between those two numbers or not. If the player fails to trap the number, the secret number can change, so it's important not to play too risky.
title: Trap Game

description: High Stakes is a russian roulette game. There is one bullet in the six-chamber revolver. The player and calculator take turns firing at themselves. Whoever lives wins the round. If at any point five shots have been made without the bullet being fired, whoever holds the gun can then shoot the other knowing it's a certain kill. There are two game modes, fair and treacherous. In the treacherous mode it's possible at any time to fire at the other player.
title: High Stakes

description:
This implementation of Conway's game of Life for the TI-59 programmable calculator has patterns evolve using the normal rules:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Life

description: Calculator Hangman is a word guessing game for SR-56 programmable calculator. One player enters a word and the other player must guess it in a limited number of turns. The calculator only supports numbers and not letters so letters are entered as values between 0 and 25. After each guess a number is shown for each position in the word the letter was found.
title: Calculator Hangman

description: Nim's game is a Nim variant for the TI-59 programmable calculator with a printer. At the start of the game the player determines the number of tokens in a pile and the maximum number of tokens a player can take each turn. The goal of the game is not to be the player to take the last token.
title: Nim's game

description: Dateline 5000 is Star Trek fangame set in the distant future and the United Nations have started colonizing other worlds. The player's goal is to colonize as many planets as possible to increase the number of resources gathered to build starships and get more of the population to man the starships. The number of starships in the fleet counts as the highscore for the player. The game ends once the player's fleet is inevitably defeated by attacking Romulan or Klingon fleets, or when the fleet is destroyed attacking their colonies. There's no player engagement in combat, it's merely a number comparison. The player will win the battle if they have equal or more ships, but lose if they have fewer.
title: Dateline 5000

description: High Noon puts the player in the role of a famous gunslinger in a Wild West town. The player enters the town on Main street and from there can move to three other locations. Each game a random number of outlaws will be present in the town, somewhere between 1 and 10. The outlaws will be spread out over the four locations randomly. So at every location the player has a chance to either spot an outlaw, giving a chance to shoot, be fired at (if the outlaws spot the player first) or have an uneasy silence which could mean there are no outlaws or that both just failed to spot each other. When the outlaws fire they have a chance to hit the player. The player wins if all outlaws are killed or loses when they get shot.
title: High Noon
